critique: The document is an approval by President Roosevelt of an agreement within the electrical contracting industry, under the authority of the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933. It reflects a strong interventionist approach by the federal government in the economy and industry, typical of the New Deal era. The agreement aims to establish fair competition and regulate labor practices within the specified region. The document also showcases the expansion of executive power during that time, with the President directly approving and ordering the implementation of the agreement based on the recommendations of the National Industrial Recovery Board.
